author: lightclient
content: EOF breakout room starting in 1 hour: https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues/677

author: axic3354
content:
Thank you all for the call!

As a reminder https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/eof1-checklist is the best place to understand the status, and the plan is to have a **spec freeze by next ACD**.

author: bobsummerwill
content: Is it realistic for the specs to be 100% frozen in only 4 more working days?  I understand that as a goal, but given the number of open questions it seems unlikely.  Perhaps a slightly softer aim?  ‚ÄúAlmost frozen‚Äù?

author: axic3354
content: Most of the change discussions are about optimising the design and are not functional, in my opinion.

author: bobsummerwill
content: How strict is ‚Äúfrozen‚Äù normally interrupted as for such a decision point?

author: axic3354
content: The only actual freeze in terms of EIPs is when they are marked Final aka network upgrade rolled out üôÇ

author: axic3354
content: But we do not want to make functional changes to the EIPs (i.e. introducing new features, significant restructuring). Changing/fixing things are on the table, as they arise during more testing and testnet operations.

author: bobsummerwill
content:
Thanks, yes, that all makes sense.

On the "until network upgrade rolled out", yes, indeed, that is the truest "consensus" which we have.   Also worthy of note is that the entire EIP process is technically optional and non-binding.  Anybody can run whatever code they like on their machine (even something completely custom and non-public) and if that can stay in consensus with the others nodes then that is just fine.   If anybody can persuade others to join in a new consensus with them, that is also fine.

For one example - the recent EthereumPOW fork never had a formal specification, and the code was just a fork of Geth plus binaries just dropped on the world AFTER the fork point.  No history, no code available ahead of the fork.  No real coordination of any kind.  Just "we forked, here is the code if you want to join us".
